noun.description: A view of or attitude toward a situation or event; an opinion.
examples: I agree with your sentiments regarding the road bridge

noun.description: Exaggerated and self-indulgent feelings of tenderness, sadness, or nostalgia.
examples: many of the appeals rely on treacly sentiment

origin: Late Middle English (in the senses personal experience and physical feeling, sensation): from Old French sentement, from medieval Latin sentimentum, from Latin sentire feel.
